title: Trump touts ‘very positive’ call with Chinese leader Xi
summary: The president noted plans to visit China in April, as Beijing sends a warning to White House over Taiwan arms sales.

title: Andrew, ex-prince linked to Epstein, moves out of royal residence
summary: Buckingham Palace announced in October that Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor would vacate Royal Lodge, though he was photographed there on horseback just this week.

title: On a paradise island in the Pacific, meth and HIV epidemics rage
summary: International criminal syndicates have been using Fiji as a transshipment point for drugs originating in Southeast Asia and Latin America.

title: Ahead of the Winter Olympics, Milan wins gold in gentrification
summary: Some advocates say the Winter Games are driving up property prices and exacerbating income inequality.

title: Russia delivers worst attack this year to Ukraine’s power sector
summary: The president said he persuaded Russia’s Vladimir Putin to stop striking Ukraine’s energy grid during a frigid period, but missiles fell on Kyiv hours later.

title: The treaty limiting U.S. and Russian nuclear arms is expiring. What to know.
summary: U.S. lawmakers have expressed concern that the end of New START could lead to “a dangerous and costly arms race” between the world’s biggest nuclear powers.

title: A year after aid cuts, the image of American power shifts under Trump
summary: The Trump administration’s America First strategy has trickled down to what’s left of the government’s humanitarian apparatus, potentially leading to millions of deaths by 2030.

title: U.S. shoots down Iranian drone that approached aircraft carrier
summary: Officials said the aircraft was “acting aggressively” when it approached the USS Abraham Lincoln, which is in the Middle East amid tensions between Washington and Tehran.

title: Iran’s killing of protesters reached level rarely seen, emergent count shows
summary: Even in the scale of global attacks on civilians and crackdowns on dissent, the magnitude of Iran’s violence against protesters stands out.

title: When his family was swept out to sea, boy swam and ran miles to save them
summary: Austin Appelbee is being hailed as a hero after he rescued his family. “I couldn’t feel how tired I was,” the 13-year-old said of his hours-long feat.

title: Stepson of Norwegian crown prince stands trial on rape, other charges
summary: The stepson of Crown Prince Haakon is accused of 38 offenses, including four counts of rape, domestic violence, assault and drug possession between 2018 and late 2024.

title: Israeli military tech start-ups cash in on two years of war
summary: While Israel has faced sharp criticism over its war in Gaza, start-up executives say foreigners are eager to buy systems developed and tested on the battlefield.
